St. John's College goes back 227 years, first as King William's
School, the first free school in Maryland, and second under its present
name for nearly a century and a half.
Francis Scott Key, author of "The Star Spangled Banner," entered
St. John's November 11, 1789, and was graduated in 1796. George
Washington was a patron of the college in its early days, and his two
nephews. Fairfax and Lawrence Washington, and stepgrandson, George
Washington Park Custis, were students there.
Dr.'Garey, who comes to St. John's from Johns Hopkins University,
is a graduate of the college, and also of the U. S. Military Academy at
West Point. He succeeds Dr. Thomas Fell, who retires after a period of
37 years of service.
The college authorities are planning an expenditure of more than
$1.250,000 for additional buildings and other equipment. A fund raiing
campaign is being organized to provide the college a minimum endow.
meat of $300,000.

St. John's College goes back 227 years, first as King William's
School, the first free school in Maryland, and second under its present
name for nearly a century and a half.
Francis Scott Key, author of "The Star Spangled Banner," entered
St. John's November 11, 1789, and was graduated in 1796. George
Washington was a patron of the college in its early days, and his two
nephews. Fairfax and Lawrence Washington, and stepgrandson, George
Washington Park Custis, were students there.
Dr.'Garey, who comes to St. John's from Johns Hopkins University,
is a graduate of the college, and also of the U. S. Military Academy at
West Point. He succeeds Dr. Thomas Fell, who retires after a period of
37 years of service.
The college authorities are planning an expenditure of more than
$1.250,000 for additional buildings and other equipment. A fund raiing
campaign is being organized to provide the college a minimum endow.
meat of $300,000.
